Description: Terracotta figure of Aphrodite Anadyomene. A figure of Aphrodite Anadyomene, nude and standing on a moulded plinth against, on her left side, a draped support. She wears a diadem and reaches up to wring out her hair. Summary treatment on the back, and a small circular vent. Hollow; two-piece mould. Micaceous brown Nile silt with an orange to grey core; the front has substantial traces of a white gypsum dressing.
Curator's comments: BM Terracotta IV Comparandum. Near: LIMC ii (2): pl. 162: Aphrodite 87, from the Fayum, dated third century ad. Bibliog. d’Athanasi 1837: lot 945; Fischer 1994: no. 920. For the gympsum dressing, see BM Department of Scientific Research Report 7048, 10 May 1999.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (3349)
